page.title: List of University of Peradeniya people

revisions.rev:
This is a list of notable [[University of Peradeniya]] people. This includes distinguished alumni of various fields and distinguished faculty people. {{Dynamic list}}
==Law, Politics and International Relations== *[[The Honourable|Hon.]] [[W. J. M. Lokubandara]] - Speaker of the parliament (2005â2010)<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.asiantribune.com/node/7803 | title=The Role of the Speaker of Parliament: W.J.M.Lokubandara - Lawyer, Poet, Song Writer, Author, Humanist & Philosopher | publisher=[[Asian Tribune]] | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> * [[Sri Lankabhimanya]] [[The Honourable|Hon.]] [[Lakshman Kadirgamar]] - Distinguished diplomat, politician and lawyer<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.island.lk/2008/08/10/features1.html | title=When Kadirgamar was killed, the Indian Prime Minister was moved to tears | publisher=The Island | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-05-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.tamilweek.com/Lakshman_Kadirgamar_0014.html | title=Lakshman Kadirgamar (1932 - 2005) | publisher=Tamil Week, [[David Jeyaraj|D.B.S Jeyaraj]] | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-05-24}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] [[Jayantha Dhanapala]], [[Sri Lanka Overseas Service|SLOS]] - former Under-Secretary-General for Disarmament Affairs, United Nations.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ices.lk/publications/esr/articles_jul98/PeraMem.pdf | title=Jayantha Dhanapala | publisher=ices.lk | format=PDF | year=2007 | accessdate=2010-05-24}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] [[Sarath Amunugama (politician)|Sarath Amunugama]] [[Member of Parliament|MP]], [[Ceylon Civil Service|CCS]] - Cabinet Minister of Public Administration and Home Affairs and former Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning.<ref name="Sunday Observer">{{cite news|url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2003/11/02/fea03.html|title=The Return to Peradeniya|last=Samaranayake|first=Ajith|date=2 November 2003|work=Sunday Observer|publisher=The Associated Newspapers of Ceylon Ltd.|accessdate=2009-07-01}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[W. A. Wiswa Warnapala|Wiswa Warnapala]] - Former Minister of Higher Education, [[Sri Lanka]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.parliament.lk/directory_of_members/ViewMember.do?memID=115 | title=Parliament profile | publisher=[[Parliament of Sri Lanka]] | year=2006 | accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] [[Dayan Jayatilleka]] [[Sri Lanka Overseas Service|SLOS]] - Permanent Mission of Sri Lanka to the [[United Nations]] at [[Geneva]] & Consul General for [[Switzerland]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.insouth.org/index.php?option=com_comprofiler&task=userProfile&user=164 | title=Dayan Jayatilleka Profile Page | publisher=Intellectual Network for the South | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-11-12}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Neelan Tiruchelvam]] - A [[Sri Lanka]]n [[Sri Lankan Tamils|Tamil]] [[politician]], peace activist and an internationally respected academic. Founder and director of the International Centre for Ethnic Studies and the founder and director of [[The Law and Society Trust]]. Assassinated by an [[LTTE]] suicide bomber in July 1999.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.asiantribune.com/index.php?q=node/3708 | title=Vice Chancelor of Jaffna University Ratnajeevan Hoole questions the warnings issued by the Messenger of Deaths in Japan | publisher=[[Asian Tribune]] | year=2006 | accessdate=2010-05-30}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://anandasangary.com/?p=491 | title=Neelan Tiruchelvam âA Sharp Mind and Full of Convictionâ by The | publisher=[[The Times]] | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-05-30}}</ref> *[[Amarasiri Dodangoda]]-Former [[Cabinet Minister]] of Public Administration and Home Affairs of [[Sri Lanka]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.lankatimes.com/fullstory.php?id=17901 | title=Minister Dodangoda pioneer of Left politics in SLFP | publisher=LankaTimes | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] [[Vikramabahu Karunaratne]] - Leader, [[New Left Front]] (NLF) and a controversial [[Politician]] in [[Sri Lanka]] *[[Harischandra Wijayatunga]] - Leader of the [[Sinhalaye Mahasammatha Bhoomiputra Pakshaya]] and the compiler of the Gunasena Great Sinhala Dictionary. *[[Hon.]] [[Justice]] [[Mark Fernando]] - Former judge of the [[Supreme Court of Sri Lanka]] *[[Hon.]] W. J. S. Karunaratne, [[Sri Lanka Administrative Service|SLAS]] - Sri Lankan High Commissioner to [[Canada]], former [[Presidential Secretariat|secretary to the president]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.island.lk/2003/08/03/news17.html| title=W. J. S. Karunaratne secy. to president | publisher=The Island | year=2003 | accessdate=2011-01-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.slmfa.gov.lk/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=693&Itemid=1 | title=His Excellency Mr. W J S Karunaratne presented his credentials to Her Excellency The Right Honourable Michaelle Jean, the Governor General of Canada | publisher=[[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Sri Lanka)]] | year=2006 | accessdate=2011-01-13}}</ref> * [[Ranjit Uyangoda]] - former [[Sri Lankan Ambassador to Japan]] and current [[Sri Lankan Ambassador to China]]<ref>{{cite web|last=Editor|title=Ambassador to China Ranjith Uyangoda presented credentials to Chinese President|url=http://www.asiantribune.com/news/2011/09/02/ambassador-china-ranjith-uyangoda-presented-credentials-chinese-president|publisher=Asiantribune|accessdate=4 September 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last=Rajasingham|first=K.T.|title=Sri Lankaâs Gentleman Diplomat â Ranjit Uyangoda|url=http://www.asiantribune.com/news/2011/03/13/sri-lanka%E2%80%99s-gentleman-diplomat-%E2%80%93-ranjit-uyangoda|publisher=Asiantribune|accessdate=4 September 2011}}</ref> * [[Nandana Gunathilake]] - Former Cabinet minister of posts and telecommunications.<ref>{{cite web|last=|first=|title=Nandana Gunatilake as Panadura mayor |url=http://www.srilankamirror.com/english/the-news/3019-nandana-gunatilake-as-panadura-mayor|publisher=Sri Lanka Mirror|accessdate=30 October 2011}}</ref> * [[Athuraliye Rathana Thero]] [[Member of Parliament|MP]]<ref>{{cite web|last=|first=|title=Venerable Athuraliye Rathana Thero|url=http://www.sadahamsevana.org/Contact%20Deatails%2002.php|publisher=sadahamsevana.org|accessdate=30 October 2011}}</ref>
==Academics== ===Professors and scholars=== *[[Sri Lankan honours system|'Kala Keerthi']], 'Dharma Shastra Visharadha Kirthi Sri', [[Professor|Prof.]] [[Anuradha Seneviratna]] - A renowned [[Sri Lanka]]n scholar<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.anuradhaseneviratna.com/ | title=Official website | publisher=Anuradhaseneviratne.com | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Gananath Obeyesekere]] - Emeritus Professor of [[Anthropology]] at [[Princeton University]] and one of the leading anthropologists in the world. Entered into an intellectual debate with [[Marshall Sahlins]] over the rationality of indigenous people through the details of [[Captain Cook|Captain James Cook's]] death in the [[Hawaiian Islands]] in 1779.<ref name="gananathobeyesekere.org">{{cite web|url=http://www.gananathobeyesekere.org/|title=Gananath Obeyesekere official website|work=www.gananathobeyesekere.org|accessdate=2010-03-15}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Rohan Abeyaratne - Director, Singapore MIT Alliance Research & Technology & Quentin Berg Professor of Mechanics in [[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]] and President of the American Academy of Mechanics, 2007-8.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://meche.mit.edu/people/index.html?id=1 | title=Rohan Abeyaratne, MIT profile | publisher=[[Massachusetts Institute of Technology]] | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Shelton Gunaratne - [[Professor emeritus]] ([[Mass Communications]]), [[Minnesota State University, Mankato|Minnesota State University]]. Writer and prominent Sri Lankan scholar<ref>{{cite news |title=Shelton Gunaratne: Home Page |url=http://www.mnstate.edu/gunarat/ |work=[[Minnesota State University, Mankato| State University]] |year=2009 |accessdate=2010-06-13 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Sri Lanka's gift to the world of Music |url=http://www.mnslff.org/AmaraPiyasara.php |work=Minnesota Friendship Foundation |year=2008 |accessdate=2010-06-13 }}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Amal Jayawardane]] - A [[Sri Lanka]]n [[historian]], [[Visiting Professor]] at the [[American University]], and Research Scholar at the Department of International Relations, [[London School of Economics]]<ref>{{cite news |title= Rich, varied collection of documents |url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2005/10/16/fea19.html |work=Sunday Observer |date=16 October 2005 |accessdate=2008-10-16 }}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Tissa Jayatilaka - Political analyst, Director of the Centre for Policy Alternatives-Sri Lanka, Director of the Fulbright Commission of Sri Lanka, Chairman of the Jury for Presidential Awards for Sri Lankan Sinhala Films and a visiting professor of [[Grinnell College]], [[USA]].<ref>{{cite news |title= Rich, varied collection of documents |url=http://www.cpalanka.org/tharea.php?th=1 |work=Centre for Policy Alternatives, Sri Lanka |year=2009 |accessdate=2010-06-13 }} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title= A conversation with Tissa Jayatilaka |url=http://web.grinnell.edu/sandb/archives/volume_118/number_4/features/tissa.html |work=[[Grinnell College]], [[USA]] |year=2001 |accessdate=2010-06-13 }}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[David Kalupahana]] - A [[Buddhist]] scholar and an [[Emeritus Professor]] of [[Philosophy]] at the [[University of Hawaii]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dharmaavenue.com/faces-lives/david-kalupahana.htm | title=David J Kalupahana | publisher=Dharmavenue.com | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Sudharshan Seneviratne - Professor of [[Archaeology]], Fulbright Visiting Professor at [[Cornell University]] and [[Carleton College]] and currently archaeological director of the [[UNESCO]] programs at [[Anuradhapura]].<ref>{{cite news |title= Sudharshan Seneviratne |url=http://www.archaeologicaltrs.com/scholars.html#seneviratne%20anchor |work=Archaeologicaltrs.com |year=2009 |accessdate=2010-06-13 }}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Padmasiri de Silva - A prominent author and a research Fellow at [[Monash University]].<ref>{{cite news |title= Prof. Padmasiri De Silva |url=http://home.vicnet.net.au/~austbud/Frame-5.htm |work= |year= |accessdate=2011-01-11 }}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] Siri Gamage - Commentator and writer on issues of [[Sri Lankan Civil War|ethnic difference and conflict in Sri Lanka]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.une.edu.au/asiacenter/ | title=Siri Gamage | publisher=[[University of New England]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Charmi Mendis-Handagama - Professor and Chief of the Reproduction Research Group at the College of Veterinary Medicine, [[University of Tennessee]].<ref>http://www.vet.utk.edu/faculty/mendis.php</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] P. V. J. Jayasekera - Professor of [[History]], Director, Institute for International Studies.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.richmondcollege.lk/html/contribution_to_nation.html | title=Contributions to the Nation: Professor P. V. J. Jayasekara | publisher=[[University Grants Commission (Sri Lanka)]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-05-30}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Lakshman S Perera - Author and archaeological researcher.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ices.lk/publications/inscriptions_vol2_part3.shtml | title=The Institutions of Ancient Ceylon from Inscriptions, Vol II, Part II | publisher=International Centre for Ethnic Studies | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] Seela Alkaduwa - Researcher and assistant Director (Research) at the International Center for Ethnic Studies (ICES)<ref>{{cite web | url=http://globalgenderstudies.buffalo.edu/faculty_staff/visiting_scholars/ | title=Visiting Scholars and Adjunct Faculty: Seela Aladuwaka | publisher=[[University at Buffalo, The State University of New York]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-05-30}}</ref> *Prof. [[Gishan Dissanaike]] - [[Financial economist]] and [[Robert Monks Professor of Corporate Governance]] at the [[University of Cambridge]]. Head of the Finance Department and Director of the Cambridge MPhil Programme in Finance.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.jbs.cam.ac.uk/research/faculty/dissanaikeg.html | title=Gishan Dissanaike: Director of the MPhil in Finance Programme | publisher=[[University of Cambridge]] | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref><ref>âDISSANAIKE, Prof. Gishan Romeshâ, Who's Who 2011, A & C Black, 2011; online edn, Oxford University Press, Dec 2010 ; online edn, Oct 2010 accessed 13 Dec 2010</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] Ram Alagan - Researcher in gender studies <ref>{{cite web | url=http://globalgenderstudies.buffalo.edu/faculty_staff/visiting_scholars/ | title=Visiting Scholars and Adjunct Faculty: Ram Alagan | publisher=[[University at Buffalo, The State University of New York]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-05-30}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] S. W. R de A Samarasinghe - Director, Tulane Institute for International Development, [[USA]] and founder-editor of ''The Kandy News''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ices.lk/publications/press.shtml | title= Studies on The Press in Sri Lanka and South Asia | publisher=Internaational Centre for Ethnic Studies | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Rajaratnam Sivachandran]] - Dean of the faculty of Arts, [[University of Jaffna]]. Prominent [[short story]] writer. *[[Professor|Prof.]] K M de Silva - Executive Director of the International Centre for Ethnic Studies.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.infolanka.com/org/srilanka/cult/45.htm | title=Situating history and ''The Historianâs Craft'' | publisher=InfoLanka | year=2001 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] K.N.O. Dharmadasa - Editor-in-Chief, [[Sinhalese people|Sinhala]] Encyclopaedia.<ref name="The Hindu">{{cite web | url=http://www.hindu.com/fline/fl2212/stories/20050617003611000.htm | title=Interview with Professor K.N.O. Dharmadasa, Editor-in-Chief, Sinhala Encyclopaedia | publisher=[[The Hindu]] | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Vidyamali Samarasinghe - Author and [[professor]] at [[American University]], [[USA]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://american.edu/sis/faculty/svidy.cfm | title=Vidyamali Samarasinghe-Professor-International Service, School | publisher=[[American University]] | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Sirima Kiribamune - Prominent author and researcher in [[gender studies]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ices.lk/publications/womens_publications.shtml | title=ICES publications on gender issues | publisher=ICES | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Michael Roberts - Sri Lankan-Australian author. [[Associate Professor]] of [[anthropology]], [[University of Adelaide]].<ref>http://www.hss.adelaide.edu.au/anthropology/staff/</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Ananda Wickremeratne - Author and [[Lecturer]] in [[Theology]] [[Loyola University of Chicago]] and Associate Member [[University of Chicago]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.amazon.com/Roots-Nationalism-Sri-Lanka/dp/9559098209 | title=Book: The Roots of Nationalism: Sri Lanka | publisher=[[Amazon.com]] | year=1998 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] R.M. Gamini Rajapakse - Prominent author.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pdn.ac.lk/sci/chem/staff/ProfRajapaksa.htm | title=Profile: Professor Gamini Rajapaakse | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Leslie Gunatilake - Director of SW Centre for natural products research and commercialisation, of the [[University of Arizona]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2007/05/27/fin15.asp | title=World renowned professionals due here to attend 'Chemtech' confab | publisher=The Sunday Observer | year=2007 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
===University Presidents, Chancellors and Vice Chancellors=== *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] [[Indira Samarasekara|Indira V. Samarasekara]] - President of the [[University of Alberta]], Canada<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.cslbcbiz.com/events.htm | title=Dr. Indira Samarasekera : Presidentâs Award Winnerâ2007| publisher=cslbcbiz.com | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Chandima Wijebandara - A prominent scholar on [[Buddhism]] and Vice Chancellor of [[University of Sri Jayewardenepura]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rivira.lk/2010/02/07/rivinetha6.htm | title=A discussion with Prof.Chandima Wijebandara | publisher=[[Rivira]] | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[S. Karunaratne|S. "SAM" Karunaratne]] - Former Vice Chancellor of [[University of Moratuwa]], current Chancellor of the [[Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology|Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology (SLIIT)]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/090208/Education/ed703.html | title=Sixty two SLIIT students receive honours at Sheffield Hallam University | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Sarath Amunugama]] - [[Vice Chancellor]] of the [[University of Kelaniya]], Sri Lanka<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.kln.ac.lk/pages/vcappoint.html | title=Professor Sarath Amunugama, assumes duties as Vice-Chancellor of University of Kelaniya | publisher=[[University of Kelaniya]] | year=2007 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[C. L. V. Jayathilake]]-[[Chancellor]] of the [[Wayamba University of Sri Lanka]] and former [[Vice Chancellor]] of the University of Peradeniya<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rshanthini.com/tmp/ThermoBook/ThermoBookPreface.pdf | format=PDF | title=Thermo Book Preface-Professor C. L. V. Jayathilake | publisher=rshanthini.com | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Leslie Panditharatne - [[Vice Chancellor]], [[University of Peradeniya]] (1978â84), Chairman of the [[University Grants Commission (Sri Lanka)|University Grants Commission of Sri Lanka]] (1993â94), Chairman and Director General of the National Institute of Business Management (N.I.B.M - 1988), Chairman and Director General of the Mineral Sands Corporation (Lanka Mineral Sands in 1989 - 1994) and Director of Studies at the American College of Higher Education.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.island.lk/2009/02/24/news15.html | title=Prof. Panditharatne conferred highest degree by SUSL | publisher=The Island | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-08-01}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] C.M. Madduma Bandara - [[Vice Chancellor]], [[University of Peradeniya]] (1994â97), Chairman of National Water Resources Authority of Sri Lanka<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.climate.lk/cmmb_index.php | title=Prof. C.M. Madduma Bandara | publisher=Foundation for Environment, Climate and Technology | year=2003 | accessdate=2010-08-01}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[S. B. S. Abayakoon]] -[[Vice-Chancellor]] of University of Peradeniya and former [[Dean (education)|Dean]] of the [[Faculty of Engineering, University of Peradeniya]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.civil.pdn.ac.lk/acstaff/abajako.html | title=Profile of Prof. S.B.S. Abayakoon | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] C.B.Dissanayake - Director, Institute of Fundamental Studies<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pdn.ac.lk/sci/geology/cbd.html | title=Professor C.B.Dissanayake | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
===Deans=== *[[Professor|Prof.]] S.H.P. Parakrama Karunaratne - [[Dean (education)|Dean]], Faculty of Science, University of Peradeniya<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pdn.ac.lk/sci/zoology/staff/shppk.html | title=S.H.P. Parakrama Karunaratne | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] M.P. Ranaweera-Former [[Dean (education)|Dean]] of the [[Faculty of Engineering, University of Peradeniya]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ce.pdn.ac.lk/conference/ | title=An international conference on âAdvances in continuum mechanics | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
==Medicine== *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Malik Peiris]], [[Royal Society|FRS]] [[LÃ©gion d'Honneur ]] - Tam Wah-Ching Professor in Medical Science; Chair Professor, Department of Microbiology at the [[University of Hong Kong]]; Scientific Director, HKU-Pasteur Research Centre. First Sri Lankan to be elected a Fellow of the [[Royal Society]], the highest scientific honour in the Commonwealth. Discoverer of [[Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome]] (SARS) virus. He proposed the Cytokine storm theory of [[avian influenza]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://archive.sciencewatch.com/sept-oct2004/sw_sept-oct2004_page3.htm | title=Malik Peiris on Containing SARS and Watching for Whatâs Next | publisher=Sciencewatch.com | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Aloka Abey Bandara - Developer of a successful Anti Biotic vaccine to control the infectious Brucellosis<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sinhala.net/LocalNews/SinhalaNet_Full_News.asp?ID=5295 | title=Virginia University honours Lankan Scientist Aloka Abey Bandara - Developed an Anti Biotic vaccine to control infectious Brucellosis | publisher=Sinhala.net | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Upali Illangasekare - Famous [[physician]] *[[Professor|Prof.]] Nimal Senanayake - Famous [[physician]]
==Science and technology== *[[Professor|Prof.]] O.A. Ileperuma - Professor of [[Chemistry]] and renowned author<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pdn.ac.lk/sci/chem/staff/ProfOAI.htm | title=Prof. O.A. Ileperuma | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Lakshman Dissanayake - Professor of [[Physics]] and famous author.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.pdn.ac.lk/sci/physics/individualStaff.php?staff_id=1 | title=Prof. M.A.K.Lakshman Dissanayake | publisher=[[University of Peradeniya]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Veerasingham Dhuruvasangary]]-A Soil Researcher and a Development Engineer.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.monsoonjournal.com/files/MJ_Dec2006_Web.pdf | format=PDF | title=Monsoon Journal | publisher=Monsoon Journal | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>
==Military and Police== *[[Major General]] [[Janaka Perera]] - [[Rana Wickrama Padakkama|RWP]], [[Rana Sura Padakkama|RSP]], [[Vishista Seva Vibhushanaya|VSV]], [[Uttama Seva Padakkama|USP]], [[Royal College of Defence Studies|RCDS]], [[psc (British Army)|Psc]], [[Sri Lanka Army Commando Regiment|CR]]-[[Chief of staff (military)|Chief of Staff]] of the [[Sri Lanka Army]] and is considered one of the most distinguished generals in Sri Lankan history<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.island.lk/2008/07/21/news3.html | title=Janaka rejects police bodyguards Firmly believes in military victory against LTTE, The Island | publisher=The Island | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Cyril Herath]]-Former [[Sri Lanka]]n [[Inspector General of Police (Sri Lanka)|Inspector-General of Police]] and [[Permanent Secretary]] to the [[Ministry of Defence (Sri Lanka)|Ministry of Defence]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/990905/bus3.html | title=Royal Bankers Club launched | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Ana Seneviratne]]-Former [[Sri Lanka]]n [[Inspector General of Police (Sri Lanka)|Inspector-General of Police]] and Sri Lankan [[High Commissioner]] to Malaysia.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/980927/let2.html | title=That meteoric rise in the Police Dept. | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=1998 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
==Literature== *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] [[Gunadasa Amarasekera]] - A prominent [[Sinhalese language|Sinhala]] [[writer]], [[poet]], and [[essayist]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.infolanka.com/org/srilanka/people/57.htm | title=''Gunadasa Amarasekera: The dentist â philosopher rooted in Sinhala soil'' | publisher=InfoLanka | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[J B Disanayake]] - Head of the Department of Sinhala, University of Colombo.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.nation.lk/2007/06/24/news3.htm | title=JB new Ambassador to Thailand | publisher=The Nation | year=2007 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Kusuma Karunaratne]] - The first female Professor of Sinhala Language and the first woman to secure a First Class Honours degree in [[Sinhala language|Sinhala]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/090208/Education/ed703.html | title=D. Litt. (Honoris Causa) for Prof. Kusuma Karunaratne | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Nihal De Silva]]-An author and a winner of [[International IMPAC Dublin Literary Award]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.impacdublinaward.ie/2005/Titles/de%20Silva.htm | title=International IMPAC Dublin Literary Award 2005 | publisher=Impacdublinaward.ie | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> and the Gratiaen Prize.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.gratiaen.com/thegratiaenprize1993-07.html | title=The Graetian Prize 1993-2007 | publisher=Gratiaen.com | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref> *[[Sengai Aaliyan]] - A notable [[Sri Lanka]]n [[Sri Lankan Tamil people|Tamil]] writer *[[Siri Gunasinghe]] - a sanskritist, art historian, premier [[Sinhalese people|Sinhalese]] [[poet]], [[novelist]], [[literary critic]] and film maker.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dailynews.lk/2010/04/07/art01.asp | title=Siri Gunasinghe felicitated | publisher=Daily News | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] SinhaRaja Tammita Delgoda - Prominent author and traveler.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.indiaplaza.in/sinharaja-tammita-delgoda.htm | title=Books by Sinharaja Tammita Delgoda | publisher=Indiaplaza.in | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *T. Arasanayagam - Prominent author.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/100502/Plus/plus_16.html | title=The countdown begins for Gratiaen Prize | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
==Film, Theatre and Television== *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Gamini Haththotuwegama|Gamini Hattotuwegama]] - Father of modern [[street theatre]] in Sri Lanka<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2009/11/01/fea03.asp | title=Haththa: Painting the drama of the street | publisher=Official Website | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Dharmasena Pathiraja]] - A [[Sri Lanka|Sri Lankan]] [[film director]] and [[screenwriter]]<ref name="SundayTim">{{cite web |url=http://www.geocities.com/dharmasenapathiraja/index.html |title=Dharmasena Pathiraja biography|year=2006 |author=Ginger, Edward|archiveurl=http://web.archive.org/web/20060220042746/http://www.geocities.com/dharmasenapathiraja/index.html|archivedate=2006-02-20}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Wimal Dissanayake - A leading scholar of [[Asian cinema]] and a pioneer in the field of Asian [[communication theory]]. He also is the general editor of a book series on [[Hong Kong cinema]] for the Hong Kong University Press and founding editor of the East-West Film Journal.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.hawaii.edu/acm/faculty/dissanayake.shtml | title=Dr. Wimal Dissanayake Lecturer | publisher=[[University of Hawaii]] | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] A J Gunawardena - Prominent [[film critic]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/981011/plus3.html | title=Farewell to a friend, critic and academic | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=1998 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Gunasena Galappatty]]-Pioneer of suspense drama in [[Sri Lanka]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.galappatty.org | title=Gunasena Galappatty official website | publisher=Official Website | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *Somalatha Subasinghe - Veteran children's [[playwright]], founder of the Childrenâs and Youth Theatre Organisation (LCYTO)<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2008/11/16/jun03.asp | title=Somalatha Subasinghe: Creator of quality childrens' entertainment | publisher=The Sunday Observer | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *Namel Weeramuni - Veteran [[playwright]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2009/01/04/spi15.asp | title=When a dumb wife becomes talkative | publisher=The Sunday Observer | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *Malani Weeramuni - Famous [[actress]] *Upali Attanayake - Famous [[actor]] *[[Dhamma Jagoda]] - First Head of the Drama Unit at the National Television channel [[Rupavahini]] and a pioneer theater and television play director and actor in Sri Lanka. *Wickrema Bogoda - Famous [[actor]] *Prema Ganegoda - Famous [[actress]] *Trilicia Gunawardena - Famous [[actress]] who played the roles of ''Anula'' in [[Lester James Peries]]' ''[[Gamperaliya]]'' and ''Maname Bisawa'' in [[Professor]] [[Ediriweera Sarachchandra]]'s ''Maname''<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/990502/mirror5.html | title=Trilicia Finishes Acting | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=1999 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
==Arts== *Stanley Kirinde [[SLAS]] - Considered one of Sri Lanka's most outstanding artistic talents of the 20th century. Former state secretary of the Ministry of Ports and Shipping. The painter of the President's House (Kandy and Colombo), the Foreign Ministry, the Military Academy.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://stanleykirinde.com/ | title=Stanley Kirinde (1930-2009) | publisher=StanleyKirinde.com | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sundayobserver.lk/2005/08/14/new40.html | title=The World of Stanley Kirinde by SinhaRaja Tammita Delgoda : Commemorating a great artist | publisher=The Sunday Observer | year=2005 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *Tilak Samarawickrema - Artist, architect and designer.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.island.lk/2009/11/22/leisure1.html | title=''Tasteful and understated eleganceâ¦'' A Cursory Glance at Tilak Samarawickremaâs Ink of Lanka | publisher=The Island | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
==Music== *Bridget Halpe - A well-known [[choir|choral director]].<ref name="pe">{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/100530/Plus/plus_19.html | title=Bridget Halpe: A life of music for 50 years | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *Bernie Marcelline - Singer of the [[choir|choral group]] ''Peradeniya singers''<ref name="pe">{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/100530/Plus/plus_19.html | title=Bridget Halpe: A life of music for 50 years | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *Rene Malawana - Singer of the [[choir|choral group]] ''Peradeniya singers''<ref name="pe">{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/100530/Plus/plus_19.html | title=Bridget Halpe: A life of music for 50 years | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *Ray Forbes - Singer of the [[choir|choral group]] ''Peradeniya singers''<ref name="pe">{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/100530/Plus/plus_19.html | title=Bridget Halpe: A life of music for 50 years | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *Monica Ludowycke - Singer of the [[choir|choral group]] ''Peradeniya singers''<ref name="pe">{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/100530/Plus/plus_19.html | title=Bridget Halpe: A life of music for 50 years | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
==Religion== *[[Bogoda Seelawimala Nayaka Thera]] - Incumbent Head Priest of the [[London Buddhist Vihara]] and the current Chief Sangha Nayaka of [[Great Britain]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.news.lk/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=5722&Itemid=44p | title=Ven. Bogoda Seelawimala Thero new Sanghanayake of Great Britain | publisher=Official Government News Portal | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Nyanaponika Thera]] - German-born Sri-Lanka-ordained [[Theravada]] monk, co-founder of the [[Buddhist Publication Society]]<sup>[http://www.bps.lk]</sup>, contemporary author of numerous seminal Theravada books, and teacher of contemporary Western Buddhist leaders such as [[Bhikkhu Bodhi]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.accesstoinsight.org/lib/authors/index.html#nyanaponika | title=Accesstoinsight.org short biography | publisher=Accesstonight.org | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref>
==Journalists== *Mohan Samaranayake - Renowned journalist and political analyist in Sri Lanka<ref name="ref1">{{cite news | url = http://www.aaupcc.org/memberdetails.asp?memberindex=1213 | title =Member Data: Mr. Mohan Samaranayake | publisher = [[University of Peradeniya]] | accessdate = 2010-08-01 }}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] S. Thillainathan - Professor of [[Tamil language|Tamil]], former editor of [[Dinakaran]] and member of the Official Languages Commission<ref name="ref1">{{cite news | url = http://www.ices.lk/publications/press.shtml | title = Studies on The Press in Sri Lanka and South Asia | publisher = ICES | year = 2009 | accessdate = 2010-06-13 }}</ref> *[[Taraki Sivaram]] - Well-known and controversial political analyst and a senior editor for [[Tamilnet]].com<ref name="ref1">{{cite news | url = http://www.tamilnet.com/art.html?catid=79&artid=14778 | title = Sivaram Dharmeratnam: A Journalistâs life | publisher = [[Tamilnet]] | author = [[Mark Whitaker|Whitaker, Mark]] | date = 2005-04-29 | accessdate = 2006-10-02 }}</ref>
==Civil Servants== *[[Lalith Weeratunga]], [[Ceylon Administrative Service|CAS]] - Current [[Permanent Secretary]] to the [[President of Sri Lanka]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.icta.lk/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=403%3Asmall-innovative-projects-can-do-wonders-lalith-weeratunga&catid=45%3Apress-releases&Itemid=78&lang=en | title=Small innovative projects can do wonders - Lalith Weeratunga | publisher=[[Information and Communication Technology Agency of Sri Lanka]] | year=1998 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[A. S. Jayawardene]], - Former [[Governor]] of the [[Central Bank of Sri Lanka]], the [[Permanent Secretary]] of the Ministry of Finance & Treasury and an Alternate Executive Director of the [[International Monetary Fund]] (IMF)<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dailynews.lk/2008/11/25/bus31.asp | title=Rising like Phoenix from the Ashes | publisher=The Daily News | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Susantha De Alwis]], [[Sri Lanka Overseas Service|SLOS]] - Former Sri Lankan [[Ambassador]] to the [[United States]], [[Japan]], [[South Korea]] and Permanent Representative to [[United Nations]] ([[Geneva]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dailynews.lk/2008/12/23/news29.asp | title=Susantha de Alwis passes away | publisher=InfoLanka | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Wilhelm Woutersz]], [[Sri Lanka Overseas Service|SLOS]] - Former [[Permanent Secretary]] to the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Sri Lanka)|Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] of [[Sri Lanka]], Sri Lankan [[Ambassador]] to [[Peopleâs Republic of China]], [[Italy]] & Yugoslavia<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.island.lk/2003/11/23/opinio01.html | title=Wilhelm Woutersz, Dutch Burgher Union President BY J. B. Muller | publisher=InfoLanka | year=2003 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[S. M. L. R. De Silva | publisher=attorneygeneral.gov.lk | year=2007 | accessdate=2010-06-16}}</ref> *H.H.Bandara [[SLAS]] - Former Assistant Director of Cultural Affairs and Assistant Secretary in the Ministry of Education.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.infolanka.com/org/diary/50.html | title=Appreciation: H.H. ==Business and finance== *[[Ajith Wickremaratne]] - Banker and a Corporate Executive. The former Vice-President and Head of Corporate Banking of NDB Bank, Sri Lanka.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.businesstoday.lk/cover_page.php?article=1302&issue=220 Source10 | title=Business Today, December 2009, NDB Bank partners with Tradecard | publisher=BusinessToday | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ndbbank.com/abt_us/annual_reports.jsp Source4 | title=NDB Bank Annual Reports | publisher=National Development Bank, Sri Lanka | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *D. K. Rajapaksa - Managing Director, DSI Samson Group (Pvt) Ltd.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/080316/Plus/plus000022.html | title=Peradeniya alumni AGM on March 23 | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
==Faculty== *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Stanley Jeyaraja Tambiah]] - Professor of [[Anthropology]] (1955â1960), a leading [[social anthropology|social anthropologist]]<ref name="Gewertz-97"/> and Esther and Sidney Rabb Professor ''(Emeritus)'' of Anthropology at [[Harvard University]].<ref name="Gewertz-97"> {{cite news | first = Ken | last = Gewertz | title = Stanley Tambiah To Be Awarded Balzan Prize For Groundbreaking Work on Ethnic Violence | url = http://news.harvard.edu/gazette/1997/10.23/StanleyTambiahT.html | work = Harvard Gazette | date = 1997-10-23 | accessdate = 2007-08-19}}</ref> Recipient of the prestigious [[Balzan Prize]],<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.balzan.it/Premiati_eng.aspx?Codice=0000001326&nome=Stanley%20Jeyaraja%20Tambiah | title = Stanley Jeyaraja Tambiah | accessdate = 2007-08-20 | publisher = Fondazione Internazionale Balzan}}</ref>the highest recognition of the [[Royal Anthropological Institute of Great Britain and Ireland]],<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.therai.org.uk/honours/honours.html | title = Honours | accessdate = 2007-08-19 | work = [[Royal Anthropological Institute of Great Britain and Ireland]] |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070809090447/http://www.therai.org.uk/honours/honours.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-08-09}}</ref> the Huxley Memorial Medal and Lecture.,<ref> {{cite web | url = http://www.therai.org.uk/honours/prior_huxley.html | title = Huxley Memorial Medal and Lecture: Prior Recipients | accessdate = 2007-08-19 | work = [[Royal Anthropological Institute of Great Britain and Ireland]] |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20070712145950/http://www.therai.org.uk/honours/prior_huxley.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-07-12}}</ref> the [[Fukuoka Asian Culture Prize]] by the city of [[Fukuoka, Fukuoka|Fukuoka]], capital of [[Fukuoka Prefecture]], [[Japan]].<ref name="Gewertz-98"> {{cite news | first = Ken | last = Gewertz | title = Stanley Tambiah To Be Awarded Fukuoka Asian Cultural Prize | url = http://news.harvard.edu/gazette/1998/08.06/StanleyTambiahT.html | work = Harvard Gazette | date = 1998-08-06 | accessdate = 2007-08-19}}</ref> Corresponding Fellow of the [[British Academy]],<ref> {{cite news | title = British Academy elects Tambiah | url = http://www.news.harvard.edu/gazette/2000/11.09/03-newsmakers.html | work = Harvard Gazette | date = 2000-11-09 | accessdate = 2007-08-19}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Senarath Paranavithana]] - The pioneering [[archeologist]] and [[epigraphist]] of Sri Lanka and once the archeological commissioner<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/980222/plus5.html | title=Where tradition comes together | publisher=The Sunday Times | year=1998 | accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> * [[Professor|Prof.]] [[Seneka Bibile]] - Founder of [[Sri Lanka National Pharmaceuticals Policy|Sri Lankaâs drug policy]] and the greatest medical benefactor of humanity that Sri Lanka has hitherto produced.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~lkawgw/sbibile.htm | title=Who was Senaka Bibile? | publisher=Rootsweb | year=2006 | accessdate=2010-06-07}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Gananath Obeyesekere]] - Professor in [[Sociology]], Emeritus Professor of [[Anthropology]] at [[Princeton University]] and one of the leading anthropologists in the world. Entered into an intellectual debate with [[Marshall Sahlins]] over the rationality of indigenous people through the details of [[Captain Cook|Captain James Cook's]] death in the [[Hawaiian Islands]] in 1779.<ref name="gananathobeyesekere.org"/> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Gunapala Piyasena Malalasekera|Gunapala Malalasekera]]; famous Sri Lankan [[scholar]] and [[diplomat]]; compiler of the "Gunapala [[Sinhala language|Sinhala]]-English [[Dictionary]]"<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.lakehouse.lk/mihintalava/sasana03.htm | title=The first ever English medium Encyclopedia of Buddhism | publisher=Lake House | year=2009 | accessdate=2011-01-14}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] John Clifford Holt - [[Visiting Professor]] of [[History]] and [[Comparative Religion]], founder of the Inter-collegiate Sri Lanka Education (ISLE) Program.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.bowdoin.edu/faculty/j/jholt/ | title=Bowdin profile: John C. Holt | publisher=[[Bowdoin College]] | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Kingsley de Silva - A prominent [[historian]], chairman of the ''International Centre for Ethnic Studies''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.ices.lk/publications/review_millenial.shtml | title=A tribute to our foremost historian-Dr. Sarath Amunugama MP | publisher=International Centre for Ethnic Studies | year=1998 | accessdate=2010-06-13}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] D.E. Hettiaratchchi - First Editor-in-Chief, [[Sinhala language|Sinhala]] Encyclopaedia.<ref name="The Hindu"/> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Adele Barker - Professor of [[Russian literature]], [[Arizona State University]]<ref>{{cite web | url=http://thewip.net/contributors/2010/02/deeply_divided_sri_lanka_throu.html | title=Sri Lanka through the Eyes of Adele Barker | publisher=Thewip.net | year=2010 | accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[Anuradha Seneviratna]] - A renowned [[Sri Lanka]]n scholar<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.anuradhaseneviratna.com/ | title=Anuradha Senevirathne: Official website | publisher=anuradhaseneviratna.com | year=2008 | accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[E.F.C. Ludowyk]] - Professor of [[English language|English]]. A prominent author in Sri Lanka. *[[Professor|Prof.]] Warren Ranjithan Breckenridge - [[Professor]] of [[Zoology]] and former president of Sri Lanka Institute of Biology.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.nassl.org/Prof.%20W.%20R.%20%20Breckenridge.htm | title=Warren Ranjithan Breckenridge 1938-2009 | publisher=National Academy of Sciences, Sri Lanka | year=2009 | accessdate=2010-06-08}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] [[George Dissanaike]] - Formerly Senior Professor and Head of the Department of Physics, [[University of Peradeniya]], Fellow of the National Academy of Sciences and a past President of the Institute of Physics, Sri Lanka.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/081005/Plus/sundaytimesplus_05.html | title=Distinguished physicist was a great teacher and complete gentleman: Professor George Alexander Dissanaike | publisher=The Sunday Times | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] Arjuna Aluwihare - [[Vice Chancellor]] of the [[University of Peradeniya]] (1988â89), Professor of [[Surgery]] 1985-2002 at the University of Peradeniya, Chairman of the [[University Grants Commission (Sri Lanka)|University Grants Commission of Sri Lanka]], WFME Executive Committee and Acting President SEARAME, SEAR and Global Advisory Committee of Health Research of [[WHO]], Commissioner Human Rights Sri Lanka.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.rootsweb.ancestry.com/~lkawgw/gen3047.html | title=Sri Lanka Sinhalese Family Genealogy: Aluwihare Family | publisher=RootsWeb | accessdate=2010-08-01}}</ref> *[[Professor|Prof.]] A. J. Wilson - Author, chair of Political Science; [[University of Peradeniya]], Head of the Department of Political Science; [[University of New Brunswick]] at [[Fredericton]].<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sundaytimes.lk/000625/plus12.html | title=Appreciation: Prof. A. J. Wilson | publisher=The Sunday Times | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref> *[[Doctor (title)|Dr.]] Robin Mayhead - Founder of the [[choir|choral group]] ''Peradeniya Singers''.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.dailynews.lk/2009/06/27/fea20.asp | title=The music will go on | publisher=The Sunday Obsever | accessdate=2010-06-14}}</ref>
